text:
Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm Ann Reardon
and this week we have a bonus video of what
to do with cake scraps.

When you make a carved cake, like this week's
Makeup Cake, or the Clash of Clans cake, you
end up with off-cuts.

Now you could of course just eat them but
if you want to turn them into something a

bit more presentable here's my secret Cake
Scraps Brownie recipe.

You will need cake scraps of course, sugar,
cocoa powder, melted butter and eggs.

Now my rich chocolate cake is quite moist
but if you're using a dryer cake you may need
to add in an extra egg.

Place the cake in a processor and process
until you get fine crumbs and I'll put all

of the recipe quantities on the HowToCookThat.net
website for you and I'll link to that below.

Pour in the melted butter, cocoa powder, eggs
and sugar and then process that again until
it's smooth.

Now this is a really quick and easy recipe
because if you've just made a 3D carved cake
you do not want to make anything fiddly.

Now pour that thick, chocolatey mixture into
a baking tray, spread it out right to the
edges.

Then sprinkle on some nuts and chocolate chips
and bake that in the oven until a knife inserted
into the brownie comes out clean.
It will still be quite soft to the touch.

Cut slices and this is the most fudgey chocolate
brownie you have ever eaten.
I like it served warm with ice-cream.

Subscribe to HowToCookThat for more cakes,
chocolates and desserts.

Click here for the recipe
Here for my YouTube channel
and here for the Makeup cake.
Make it a great week and I'll see you on Friday!
